summary: This bill, the "Vital Documents Access for Unaccompanied Homeless Youth Act of 2025," aims to improve access to vital documents, such as birth certificates and social security cards, for unaccompanied homeless youth. It mandates the establishment of an interagency task force, comprised of federal officials, state representatives, and non-profit organization representatives, to coordinate efforts, share best practices, and develop policies to aid youth in obtaining these critical documents. The task force will issue quarterly reports and submit an initial report within one year and a final report within three years addressing challenges, policies, and effectiveness. The covered secretaries are the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Secretary of Health and Human Services.
